Package ohos.agp.components

Class TabList

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.Component
      • ohos.agp.components.ComponentContainer
        • ohos.agp.components.StackLayout
          • ohos.agp.components.ScrollView
            • ohos.agp.components.TabList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentParent

    public class TabList
extends ScrollView
    Displays the directional layout of tabs and allows the content in the layout to scroll along the layout direction.

    You can create a tab using a TabList object, and then add the new tab to the list using addTab(ohos.agp.components.TabList.Tab). The layout direction can be either Component.HORIZONTAL or Component.VERTICAL. The default direction is horizontal.

    Since:
    3

        Adds a tab to the end of the current layout.
        Parameters:
        tab - Indicates the tab to add.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the tab value is null.
        Since:
        3

      • addTab

        public void addTab​(TabList.Tab tab,
                   int pos)
        Adds a tab to the specified position in the current layout.
        Parameters:
        tab - Indicates the tab to add to the specified position.
        pos - Indicates the position where to add the tab, which must be a non-negative integer less than the total number of tabs.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the tab value is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the pos value is less than 0.
        Since:
        3

      • addTab

        public void addTab​(TabList.Tab tab,
                   boolean selected)
        Adds a tab to the end of the current layout and specifies whether it is selected.
        Parameters:
        tab - Indicates the tab to add.
        selected - Indicates whether the tab is selected. true indicates the tab is selected; false indicates otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the tab value is null.
        Since:
        3

      • addTab

        public void addTab​(TabList.Tab tab,
                   int pos,
                   boolean selected)
        Adds a tab to a position in the current layout and specifies whether it is selected.
        Parameters:
        tab - Indicates the tab to add.
        pos - Indicates the position where to add the tab.
        selected - Indicates whether the tab is selected. true indicates that the tab is selected; and false indicates the opposite.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the tab value is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the pos value is less than 0.
        Since:
        3

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the parameter value is null.
        Since:

      • removeTab

        public void removeTab​(int pos)
        Removes a tab from the specified position.
        Parameters:
        pos - Indicates the position of the tab to remove. The value must be a non-negative integer less than the total number of the tabs.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the pos value is less than 0 or no tab on this position.
        Since:
        3

      • getTabAt

        public TabList.Tab getTabAt​(int pos)
        Obtains the tab in a specified position.

        This method returns the tab in the specified position, or a null pointer if the position is invalid.

        Parameters:
        pos - Indicates the position of the tab. The value must be a non-negative integer.
        Returns:
        Returns the tab in the specified position.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the parameter value is less than 0.
        Since:
        3

      • selectTab

        public void selectTab​(TabList.Tab tab)
        Selects a tab.

        The previously selected tab is automatically deselected if it belongs to the current component.

        Parameters:
        tab - Indicates the tab to select.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the parameter value is null.
        Since:

        public int getTabTextSize​()

        Returns:

        Since:

      • getTabTextAlignment

        public int getTabTextAlignment​()
        Obtains the text alignment mode of a table.
        Returns:
        Returns a non-negative integer representing the text alignment mode.
        • TextAlignment.LEFT: left aligned
        • TextAlignment.RIGHT: right aligned
        • TextAlignment.HORIZONTAL_CENTER: horizontally centered
        • TextAlignment.TOP: top aligned
        • TextAlignment.VERTICAL_CENTER: vertically centered
        • TextAlignment.BOTTOM: bottom aligned
        • TextAlignment.CENTER: horizontally and vertically centered
        Since:
        4

      • getTabLength

        public int getTabLength​()
        Obtains the length of all tabs in a table,which is a non-negative integer.
        Returns:
        Returns the length.
        Since:
        4

      • getTabMargin

        public int getTabMargin​()
        Obtains the margin (in pixels) between two adjacent tabs in a table.
        Since:
        4

      • setTabTextAlignment

        public void setTabTextAlignment​(int alignment)
        Sets the text alignment for all tabs in a component.
        Parameters:
        alignment - Indicates the text alignment of tabs.
        • TextAlignment.LEFT: Left alignment;
        • TextAlignment.RIGHT: Right alignment;
        • TextAlignment.HORIZONTAL_CENTER: Horizontally centered;
        • TextAlignment.TOP: Top alignment;
        • TextAlignment.VERTICAL_CENTER: Vertically centered;
        • TextAlignment.BOTTOM: Bottom alignment;
        • TextAlignment.CENTER: Horizontally and vertically centered.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws the exception if the parameter value doesn't corresponds to TextAlignment.

      • setTabLength

        public void setTabLength​(int length)
        Sets a width or height for all tabs in a layout.

        The tab width is set in a horizontal layout, while the tab height is set in a vertical layout. The value must be a non-negative integer.

        Parameters:
        length - Indicates the tab width or height.
        Since:
        3

      • setTabMargin

        public void setTabMargin​(int margin)
        Sets a margin between two tabs in a component.
        Parameters:
        margin - Indicates the margin between two tabs. The value must be a non-negative integer.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the parameter value is less than 0.
        Since:
        3

      • setFixedMode

        public void setFixedMode​(boolean isFixed)
        Sets whether to fix all tabs and display them at the same time.

        If the fixed mode is disabled, the width or height of the layout equals to the total width or height of all tabs in it. If the fixed mode is enabled, the width or height of the layout is fixed and each tab in it has the same width or height.

        Parameters:
        isFixed - Indicates whether tabs are fixed in the layout. true indicates that all tabs are fixed, and false indicates the opposite.
        Since:
        3

      • isFixedMode

        public boolean isFixedMode​()
        Obtains whether the fixed mode is enabled. By default, the fixed mode is disabled.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the fixed mode is enabled; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        setFixedMode(boolean)

        Parameters:
